Issues.Title: update formControl value if valid angular reactive forms
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request
Option to allow formControl value to update if valid or pass given validations.

### Description

Current behavior allow to update the formControl value even if it's invalid.

![formControl](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4208015/55530309-38056580-56c3-11e9-88ca-a6392273e000.gif)


```
 return new FormGroup({
        position:  new FormControl(entity.position, Validators.required),
        name: new FormControl(entity.name, Validators.required), 
        weight: new FormControl(entity.weight, Validators.required),
        symbol: new FormControl(entity.symbol, Validators.required)
      },{

updateValueIfValid: true // default false

);
```
You can find the working demo, where i am using a mat-table with custom inline editing with mat-input.

I would be great if there is a option that let us enable or disable( default ) update formControl value only if it's a valid one. We can pass this option while creating a formControl or formGroup or formArray.


Here is working [demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-mat-table-editable?embed=1&file=app/table-basic-example.ts&view=preview).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "update formControl value if valid angular reactive forms" (#29699)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): prefix all instructions
Issues.Body:
Updates all exported Ivy template instructions to be prefixed with `‚Å±`, per [this design document](https://hackmd.io/c/BkDUxaW84/%2Foj_ep41WQnm7al6_vgDi0A)

- Also removes an unnecessary `export` from `styling_instructions`, which was `elementStylingApplyInternal`.
- Updates `global_utils_api.ts` to export a `markDirty` function that wraps the instruction, rather than re-export. This is because re-exported functions don't emit the expected .d.ts files per the public api guardian tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): prefix all instructions" (#29692)

Issues.Title: [Ivy] Component composition (inheritance) breaks rendering
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/....    Seems to be an issue considered to be crosscutting?


### Is this a regression?
Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular 7.3.7;  It also works with Angular 8.0.0-beta.10 when not using Ivy

According to this [source for Ivy status](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/src/render3/STATUS.md#crosscutting), extending components should now be supported with Ivy if I'm not mistaken.


### Description
When a component extends another component, the derived component and the components included in its template are not rendered on the screen.  I can see the the component tag by inspecting the DOM with devtools, but its actual content is not displayed.

I can also verify the constructor of the base class is called as expected.  However, it is not possible to get a reference to a child component inserted in the template of the derived component using @ViewChild (neither from the base component nor from the derived component).

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
I have created this repo with a minimal reproduction of the problem: [Component inheritance with Ivy](https://github.com/MakesNine/TestIvy8Beta10)

I have also created another repo, with the same code but created with Angular 8.0.0-beta.10 without Ivy enabled to show that it works in this case: [Component inheritance without Ivy](https://github.com/MakesNine/TestNoIvy)

## üî• Exception or Error
Content is not rendered and @ViewChild doesn't work.


## üåç  Your Environment

Angular CLI: 8.0.0-beta.10
Node: 10.15.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.0.0-beta.10
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.800.0-beta.10
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.800.0-beta.10
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.800.0-beta.10
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.800.0-beta.10
@angular-devkit/core              8.0.0-beta.10
@angular-devkit/schematics        8.0.0-beta.10
@ngtools/webpack                  8.0.0-beta.10
@schematics/angular               8.0.0-beta.10
@schematics/update                0.800.0-beta.10
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.3.4000
webpack                           4.29.6

**Anything else relevant?**
Tested with Chrome
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Ivy] Component composition (inheritance) breaks rendering" (#29687)

Issues.Title: Dependency injection for pipes does not follow view hierarchy
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No(?) ### Description If a pipe injects a value, it does not consider the injectors of directives/components that are its parents in the template. It only considers the injector of the component that owns the template. E.g. If have the following component template: ```html {{ 'some value to transform' | consumerPipe }} ``` Attempting to inject `MyProviderComponent` into `consumerPipe` will not work. Any providers defined on `my-provider`, or any other directive that wraps the use of `consumerPipe` in the view template will not be applied. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dadbae?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html In this example the value provided by `app-provider` component is only injected into the consumer component, but not the consumer pipe. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.3.4
Node: 8.11.4
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.7
... common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms, http
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Issues.Title: Directive `routerLink` dont correctly work with empty `fragment` option
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Description When `fragment` of `routerLink` are empty the anchor save `#` in `href`. But expected will remove `#` character for use clean url. So, for fix this issue I need use two diffrent temaplates of one link: with fragment and without. I think this is not pretty decision. And I think the solution located something here: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/7.2.x/packages/router/src/url_tree.ts#L293 Now: ```ts const fragment = typeof tree.fragment === `string` ? `#${encodeUriFragment(tree.fragment !)}` : ''; ``` But it should be something like this: ```ts const fragment = (typeof tree.fragment === `string` && tree.fragment) ? `#${encodeUriFragment(tree.fragment !)}` : ''; ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ```ts link 1 with fragment link 2 with blank fragment ``` https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-puzmfb?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2697890/55480773-b0b7e380-5629-11e9-9b6d-dee24c9a2d7e.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Directive `routerLink` dont correctly work with empty `fragment` option" (#29683)

If you forget to include `@npm//@angular/core` in your deps, you get a big stack trace from ngc:

```
Error: Could not resolve module @angular/core
    at StaticSymbolResolver.getSymbolByModule (/usr/local/google/home/alexeagle/.cache/bazel/_bazel_alexeagle/5c0aaa094e7be03dbabccfd0d5d7e8a8/execroot/angular_bazel_example/bazel-out/host/bin/external/npm/node_modules/@angular/bazel/ngc-wrapped__bin.runfiles/npm/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:23786:34)
    at StaticReflector.findDeclaration (/usr/local/google/home/alexeagle/.cache/bazel/_bazel_alexeagle/5c0aaa094e7be03dbabccfd0d5d7e8a8/execroot/angular_bazel_example/bazel-out/host/bin/external/npm/node_modules/@angular/bazel/ngc-wrapped__bin.runfiles/npm/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:25172:67)
    at StaticReflector.initializeConversionMap (/usr/local/google/home/alexeagle/.cache/bazel/_bazel_alexeagle/5c0aaa094e7be03dbabccfd0d5d7e8a8/execroot/angular_bazel_example/bazel-out/host/bin/external/npm/node_modules/@angular/bazel/ngc-wrapped__bin.runfiles/npm/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:25409:55)
    at new StaticReflector (/usr/local/google/home/alexeagle/.cache/bazel/_bazel_alexeagle/5c0aaa094e7be03dbabccfd0d5d7e8a8/execroot/angular_bazel_example/bazel-out/host/bin/external/npm/node_modules/@angular/bazel/ngc-wrapped__bin.runfiles/npm/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:25140:18)
```

But if you're missing something like `@angular/router` the error is a bit better:
```
ERROR: /usr/local/google/home/alexeagle/Projects/angular-bazel-example/src/app/home/BUILD.bazel:5:1: Compiling Angular templates (ngc) //src/app/home:home failed (Exit 1)
src/app/home/home.ts(2,28): error TS2307: Cannot find module '@angular/router'.
```

however in all these cases, under Bazel we should mention "maybe you meant to add @angular/package to deps of //path/to:target"

Issues.Title: Memory footprint of angular 7
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Unfortunately, I cannot tell precisely, which package of @angular is causing the behavior. ### Is this a regression? Yes, the memory footprint raised a lot after upgrading from angular 6.1.0 to angular 7.1.3. ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... After upgrading a quite large application (about 300-400 components and a lot of providers, @ngxs and @ngrx) from angular+angular/material from v6 to v7 without chaning the rest of the code (only occurences that caused compilation failures) I noticed a lot of memory overhead. Comparing two memory dumps from app before and after upgrade it looks like this: Memory dump of @angular v7 app ![v7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8741982/51113383-1605f080-1802-11e9-84a0-fdad97e3c12e.png) Memory dump of @angular v6 app ![v6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8741982/51113407-24eca300-1802-11e9-86cb-c567a1bd3afc.png) These heap snapshots were taken after logging in to both apps, navigating to a page with a lot of stuff going on and doing a refresh in both instances. After the initial load finished, I took the snapshots. Comparing the two heap sizes, the heap size difference between v6 and v7 is always the difference of (string) constants in memory. Did anyone notice the same behavior already? Is it something renderer or compiler specific? I don't know, how to isolate the problem. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction As this problem is only notable for a large application, there is no "minimal" repro. I also cannot publish the code of the faulty app, as it is a productive app. ## üî• Exception or Error See Description ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: style: remove todo comment from `updateClassDeclaration`
Issues.Body:
A transformer should not mutate existing nodes, ever. If you intend to modify some part of the node, the `ts.update*` methods are correct. Or you can replace a node entirely via `ts.create*` operations, but there are cases where introducing entirely synthetic nodes will break TS output.

Hence using the `updateClassDeclaration` in this case is the correct approach.

This has also been raised in the slack #ts-core channel as TypeScript have been looking to get to the bottom of this https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/29365#issuecomment-479230994, which seemed to have been caused by mutating the node.

Also confirmed with @alxhub.

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): differential loading
Issues.Body:
--- WORK IN PROGRESS ---

This PR is work in progress with the intention to get early feedback before providing the complete one.

This PR adds differential loading to the browser builder. First, it checks if differential loading is needed. This is the case if the compilation target is ES2015 while the browserslist points to ES5 browsers. 

For providing differential loading, it calls the methods for creating the webpack config for each compilation target (e. g. ES5 and ES2015). The needed differences between those configurations are defined using parameters also added by this PR. Then it calls webpack for each of them, merges the results and writes the index.html.

Not implemented yet:

- Call function to write index.html
- Test with Service Worker
- Test with es2015-polyfills for ES5 browsers
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): differential loading" (#14061)

Issues.Title: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory error when deleting files with `ng build --watch`
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Just adopting Angular CLI, so this is not known ### Description We are using Angular CLI in a bit of a non-standard way. We have a core product but have "extensions" to our software packaged separately. I'm using the lazy module (via `loadChildren`) support to be able to do subsequent builds. So our workflow is currently to start the `ng build` in watch mode with a custom configuration, and then add or remove modules to a lazy route file. The idea is that we may have thousands of extensions that are loaded dynamically by the client, so we only build them on demand. This is hard with webpack. The problem I am experiencing is that after deleting these modules, webpack is still looking for them. A clear and concise description of the problem... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create an Angular application with one lazy route module with no routes (see below) 2. Start `ng build --watch` 3. Add in a new module file into the source directory (say module A) 4. Reference the module from the lazy route module using `loadChildren` 5. Wait for the build to pick up the changes 6. Delete the module and remove it from the lazy route module 7. Add a different new module file and add it to the lazy route module (say module B) During the compilation of the new module, the error above occurs. At this point, it is trying to still build module A even though it was removed from the file system. Note that I'm using watch mode as building with AOT is too slow starting each time (~1 minute on a single build vs. ~15 seconds with an incremental watch build, which will not meet our KPIs). ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: RegExp constructor in NgModule annotation config not compiled to output for --prod
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [X] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, I think so. The documentation of the [Angularlitics2](https://github.com/angulartics/angulartics2#remove-ids-from-url-paths) package shows that this works, and assuming the Angular documentation on [supported expressions in annotations](https://angular.io/guide/aot-compiler#expression-syntax) is still correct, it should work. ### Description I'm using the [Angularlitics2](https://github.com/angulartics/angulartics2) package to track page views. There is optional config to provide a RegExp that [removes ID's from tracked URL paths](https://github.com/angulartics/angulartics2#remove-ids-from-url-paths). This seems to work fine for JIT (non-prod) builds. But when adding the `--prod` flag, it seems that RegExp is stripped from the compiled build. This is kind of a derivative of https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/13702 which also doesn't work, but as pointed out in the bug, probably shouldn't work. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/mtraynham/angular-module-regex-constructor 1. `ng new angular-module-regex-constructor` (routing Y; CSS) 2. Add Angularlitics, e.g. this [commit](https://github.com/mtraynham/angular-module-regex-constructor/commit/39d4501b5d811d24aee60ab7ec1cbda4ab92b651). 3. Compile with `ng build --prod`. 4. Search for `idsRegExp` in the compiled output and find no instances of the configured `idsRegExp: new RegExp('^[a-z]\\d+$')`. I went ahead and ran `ng build --vendor-chunk`, `ng build --prod --vendor-chunk`, `ng build --prod --aot --vendor-chunk` and committed them to that same repository (after beautifying the main files). It works in the standard build case, but not when using `--prod` as identified by the following lines: JIT - https://github.com/mtraynham/angular-module-regex-constructor/blob/master/dist/angular-module-regex-constructor/main.js#L149-L153 ```js angulartics2__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_5__["Angulartics2Module"].forRoot({ pageTracking: { clearIds: true, idsRegExp: new RegExp('^[a-z]\\d+$') /* Workaround: No NgModule metadata found for 'AppModule' */ } }) ``` Prod - https://github.com/mtraynham/angular-module-regex-constructor/blob/master/dist/angular-module-regex-constructor-prod/main.5ede6a1bdd2f105d28e3.js#L54 ```js b.qb(256, M.a, {settings: {pageTracking: {clearIds: !0}}}, []) ``` Prod AOT - https://github.com/mtraynham/angular-module-regex-constructor/blob/master/dist/angular-module-regex-constructor-prod-aot/main.5ede6a1bdd2f105d28e3.js#L54 ```js b.qb(256, M.a, {settings: {pageTracking: {clearIds: !0}}}, []) ``` ## üî• Exception or Error No error thrown. ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 7.3.7
Node: 11.13.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.13.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.13.7
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.13.7
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.7
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.7
@angular/cli                      7.3.7
@ngtools/webpack                  7.3.7
@schematics/angular               7.3.7
@schematics/update                0.13.7
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.29.0
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: cdkDragDelay input doesn't actually work
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Bind cdkDragDelay like `[cdkDragStartDelay]="..."` works.

#### What is the current behavior?
Specifying `cdkDragStartDelay="..."` allows the app the load but doesn't actually delay. Specifying `[cdkDragStartDelay]="..."` results in error message at run time:
```
Template parse errors:
Can't bind to 'cdkDragStartDelay' since it isn't a known property of 'div'.
```

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-cdkdragdelay


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Material 7.3.6

#### Is there anything else we should know?

Issues.Title: Mat-Tab - No scrollbar in mat-tab content
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The scrollbar should appear if contents are going beyond the view area


#### What is the current behavior?
No scrollbar is appearing


#### What are the steps to reproduce?
See the following Stackblitz example. It is the same as on the official website; I have added some large content. Notice that scrollbar is on the whole page not in the respective tab. My chrome browser version is - **Version 73.0.3683.86 (Official Build) (64-bit)**
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-jakbce?file=app/tab-group-basic-example.html
**NOTE - Scrollbar may appear in Chrome Version 72. But for some reason scrollbar is not visible in Chrome Version 73**


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Chrome browser version - **Version 73.0.3683.86 (Official Build) (64-bit)**

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I could see a similar issue(s) were logged before and a possible solution was height: 100% but for some reason on the specified chrome browser version, the scrollbar is not appearing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Tab - No scrollbar in mat-tab content" (#15707)

Issues.Title: fix: error when attempting to access Intl API on some versions of Windows
Issues.Body:
On some versions of Windows merely trying to access the `Intl` object can cause IE to throw an error, if the default `Map` object has been overwritten (e.g. when polyfilling). These changes add a `try/catch` around our usages so that users' apps don't crash completely on load.

Fixes #15687.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix: error when attempting to access Intl API on some versions of Windows" (#15693)

Issues.Title: Critical crash bug "typeError: intl is not available"
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Have a fallback for Intl while is not available

#### What is the current behavior?
Unexpectedly, all the app crashed and "typeError: intl is not available" error is presented at console.
Only IE-11 

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
I Don't know if we can repro this, but I'll give the background story as far as it can help.
While changing the localization - 

App crashed on this line: 
const hasV8BreakIterator = (typeof Intl !== 'undefined' && (Intl as any).v8BreakIterator);  
from this file:
https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/cdk/platform/platform.ts

with this error: "typeError: intl is not available".
This crash won't let the app start, and there is no fallback.
We manage to fix it while editing the vendor.**.js file, and adding try-catch
block for this line.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular: 7.2.1
CDK: 7.2.1
TypeScript: 3.2.2
Browsers: IE 11

#### Is there anything else we should know?
**Critical bug**, should provide hotfix.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Critical crash bug "typeError: intl is not available"" (#15687)

Issues.Title: feat(typography): align with 2018 material design spec
Issues.Body:
* Add support for overline text
* Add specs from type system design document at https://material.io/design/typography/the-type-system.html

Closes #12974

BREAKING CHANGES:

- The following typography CSS classes have been removed and/or replaced with the associating CSS classes:

  | Removed class | Replaced class |
  |---|---|
  | `.mat-body-strong` | No equivalant |

Issues.Body:
I am using linear mat-stepper.

It works fine with next.  I do api call & if it's success then i call stepper-next event instead of using matStepperNext directive.

Now when user fills all data on step 1 & **directly click** on some other **step in heade**r of next(or any other on edit record mode) then it will redirect to next step since form is valid.

I want to do **service call before** that & **prevent step-change until service call is successful** then only it should redirect to next step otherwise it shouldn't.

I can't find any method to implement this functionality in doc.

Can anyone suggest me what to do. I don't want to disable header click.

Issues.Title: refactor: move version export to core entry-point
Issues.Body:
* Moves the `VERSION` export to the the `core` secondary entry-point. This ensures that the V8 package schematics don't resolve the `VERSION` symbol to the incorrect `@angular/material/typings` module name.
* Removes the unused and outdated material subpackages test case that has been replaced with a working one.
* Ensures that the V8 material imports rule resolves the symbol from the imported identifier and not from the aliased one (minor cleanup; no effect as we resolve the identifer to the original symbol anyway; just slower)

Related to: https://github.com/angular/material.angular.io/pull/590
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: move version export to core entry-point" (#15700)

Issues.Title: Dynamic autocomplete options - "reboot"
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Currently working with the autocompleter (or select) and using different templates which define and bubble up mat-optgroups is a challenging and manual process requiring understanding of the inner workings of the components and direct access of private fields.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/dynamic-autocomplete

In addition, when there are no "real" top-level options, a shim disabled option must be inserted and then disguised (or else very undesirable workarounds that don't work well with ngrx state-driven option lists must be undertaken).  Otherwise, the autocomplete will not open, and reindexing of select handlers for the dynamic options will fail, so that the list either does not appear initially or cannot be navigated/selected from.

As this is a common use case for autocompleters with behavior driven by another selection (e.g.), and we do not want to access internals, we would like to propose a "reboot" method on the autocomplete (and select) whereby a group of MatOptions can be provided and Material will handle getting things into the correct state.

e.g.
```
...
this.autocomplete.setOptions(options);
...
```


#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

We have encountered multiple scenarios that were best handled by choosing between multiple optgroup-producing templates.  For instance, another select may cause the user to choose a "Type" which then should drive our autocomplete to choose between a very complicated and a very simple template.

Currently, realizing this behavior (without putting all of it in one god controller) is unsafe as we must access class internals, and requires specific and fragile knowledge and patterns.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dynamic autocomplete options - "reboot"" (#15697)

Issues.Title: mat-selection-list: selectAll and deselectAll methods should trigger selectionChange event
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
`selectAll()` and `deselectAll()` methods on `MatSelectionList` should automatically trigger the `selectionChange` event.


#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Select some documents from a list.

The `MatListOption`s have `[value]` populated with an object containing a number of properties of the document (name, file size, last edited date, expiry date, etc.).
You want to communicate a warning to the user that specifies the number of expired documents in their current selection.
It's easy enough to calculate the number of expired documents in the current selection when the `selectionChange` event is fired, but if the user decides to `selectAll`, this event is not triggered, so additional workarounds need to be made to cover this case.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-selection-list: selectAll and deselectAll methods should trigger selectionChange event" (#15696)

Issues.Title: Use MatAutocomple without MatInput
Issues.Body:
I want to use MatAutocomplete on a bootstrap-styled input. Unfortunately, being able to use MatAutocomplete requires surrounding the input with a mat-form-field and giving the input itself a matInput-directive.

I was wondering if it is possible to avoid using
- mat-form-field
- matInput
- or at least use them in a "headless-mode" so they handle things like focus and model change subscriptions, but do not edit the template

The original mat-input is just too big and too interactive for many use cases. I am sure many people would like to replace it's style.

By the way, if the matInput directive is missing, you get the very misleading message

```
UiBootstrapSearchComponent.html:8 ERROR Error: mat-form-field must contain a MatFormFieldControl.
    at getMatFormFieldMissingControlError (form-field.es5.js:119)
    at MatFormField.push.../../node_modules/@angular/material/esm5/form-field.es5.js.MatFormField._validateControlChild (form-field.es5.js:771)
    at MatFormField.push.../../node_modules/@angular/material/esm5/form-field.es5.js.MatFormField.ngAfterContentInit (form-field.es5.js:453)
    at callProviderLifecycles (core.js:22409)
    at callElementProvidersLifecycles (core.js:22390)
    at callLifecycleHooksChildrenFirst (core.js:22380)
    at checkAndUpdateView (core.js:23311)
    at callViewAction (core.js:23548)
    at execComponentViewsAction (core.js:23490)
    at checkAndUpdateView (core.js:23313)
```
even though it is matInput and not [formControl] missing
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Use MatAutocomple without MatInput" (#15684)
